last_episode_to_air.name: The Lunar Rover
last_episode_to_air.overview: The series' final episode centers on the design and perfection of the novel Lunar Roving vehicle carried to the Moon on the Apollo J-class missions.

name: Moon Machines
overview: Moon Machines in the US and UK is a Science Channel HD documentary miniseries consisting of six episodes documenting the engineering challenges of the Apollo Program to land a man on the Moon. It covers everything from the iconic Saturn V to the Command Module, the Lunar Module, the Space Suits, the Guidance and Control Computer, and the Lunar Rover. It was created by the team who made In the Shadow of the Moon in association with NASA to commemorate the agency's fiftieth anniversary in 2008. It first aired in June 2008 and was released on DVD a year later in June 2009.

episodes.name: The Saturn V Rocket
episodes.overview: The first episode of the series documents the creation of the iconic Saturn V rocket.

episodes.name: The Command Module
episodes.overview: The second episode is centered around the construction of the Apollo Command Module and the setback of the Apollo 1 fire.

episodes.name: The Navigation Computer
episodes.overview: The third episode details the story of MIT's work on the Apollo Guidance Computer.

episodes.name: The Lunar Module
episodes.overview: The fourth episode features the Grumman project to build mankind's only true spacecraft - the Lunar Module.

episodes.name: The Space Suit
episodes.overview: The penultimate episode focuses on the teams that created the remarkable Apollo pressure suit.

episodes.name: The Lunar Rover
episodes.overview: The series' final episode centers on the design and perfection of the novel Lunar Roving vehicle carried to the Moon on the Apollo J-class missions.
